events.text:
Made by Viridino Studios (@ViridinoStudios)

Mateus Ferreira - Programmer
Twitter: @BonzerKitten
E-mail: ferreiramoreiramateus@gmail.com

Wesley Andrade - Artist
Twitter: @andrart7
E-mail: wesleymatos1989@gmail.com

Made with the support of patrons on https://www.patreon.com/viridinostudios

children.text: Reset global variables to prevent traces from previous sessions.
Setup the player by adding its graphics to the collider as a child.
Receive and store input from the player to be used later in many situations.
Toggle input left.
Toggle input right.
Toggle input up.
Toggle input down.
Calculate both axis and looking angle based on the player input.
Move the player horizontally based on its horizontal axis.
Simulate player jump.
Mirro the player graphics based on its horizontal axis.
Change the animation states depending on what the player is currently doing.
Walk animation.
Idle animation.
Jump animation.
Fall animation.
Spawn different types of dust particles depending on the player actions.
Walking dust.
Landing dust.
Jumping dust.
Setup the trigger position to match to platform top mechanism.
Setup the back part of the teleport platform by moving it to the bottom of the layer.
Setup the front part of the teleport platform by moving it to the top of the layer.
Destroy the player object and create a giant white flash.
Setup the giant white flash and animate it to disappear after some time.
Check if the player is able to perform a roll in the air and execute it.
Once the roll animation is over, perform an air stomp attack towards the ground.

actions.text: Spawn and attach the feet shock effect.
Move the player towards the ground.

children.text: While the player is moving down, create a trail effect behind the him.

actions.text: Adjust the trail angle to point towards the bullet.
Adjust the trail width to reach the bullet last position.

children.text: Also spawn Z shaped shock effects every 0.0025 seconds.
Check solid collisions in order to stop the air stomp attack.
Spawn a "Z" shaped shock effect and randomize some of its parameters.
Generate a sequence of objects composing the shock animation.
Create a whole thunder by spawning a sequence of objects with different angle, varying from -30 to +30 after each iteration.
Offset the thunder texture in order to give it a feeling of noisy motion.
Stop the air stomp animation and reset the overall player state.
Update the player last position.
Destroy the particles after their animation is done to prevent CPU overload.
How fast the camera will track the player.
How far from the player the camera will be.
Interpolate the camera position to constantly track the player with smooth movement.

parameters.x: lerp(Self.X, PlayerCollision.X + CAMERAOFFSETX, CameraSpeed * TARGETFRAMERATE * dt)
parameters.y: lerp(Self.Y, PlayerCollision.Y + CAMERAOFFSETY, CameraSpeed * TARGETFRAMERATE * dt)

children.text: Create a screen shake effect to add more intensity to specific actions.
If the player collides with a spike, restart the game.
Update the pixellate effect to match the current pixel density of the window.
Set a random animation for the block once it's created to a bit of variety to the level.
Start the self destroy sequence on a specific block based on its UID.
Check each neighbor of each self destroying block to activate them as well.
Spawn a couple of debris after a block is destroyed.
Enable bounce off solids if the debris are not overlapping a solid object anymore.
Constantly scroll the background texture, to create an environment that feels more alive.
Restart the game.
Close the game.
